metadata.title: CVE-2017-7617 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Remote code execution can occur in Asterisk Open Source 13.x before 13.14.1and 14.x before 14.3.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before 13.13-cert3because of a buffer overflow in a CDR user field, related to X-ClientCodein chan_sip, the CDR dialplan function, and the AMI Monitor action.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-config - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: asterisk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:13.1.0~dfsg-1.1ubuntu4.1+esm1').
